item.description:
Dead Man's Cell Phone

This play is a comedy about how we live on through technology. When a man dies in a restaurant, his cell phone rings and a woman at the next table answers it. She then gets involved in his life, making up stories to his family and friends. It sounds kind of like the movie "While You Were Sleeping" with Sandra Bullock....Here's a review of a production in Oregon. It looks pretty funny.

I know Fridays can be tough for some of us, but I picked this date because tickets are a little cheaper. The cost per ticket is $40 ticket + outrageous handling fees = $46. Please pay through this site (Amazon payments) when you RSVP. There aren't a lot of tickets left, so please RSVP by 5 pm on Feb. 4.

We will meet in the lobby of Trinity Repertory Company at 7 pm. After the show, we'll head around the corner to Trinity Brewhouse for dinner/drinks/apps.
item.name: Dead Man's Cell Phone -- Trinity Rep
